name: Hawthorn
climate: Hawthorn thrives in temperate climates where winters are cool.
It can tolerate a range of climates, from mild to colder zones.
Prefers climates that have distinct seasonal changes for growth.
Hawthorn can withstand harsh winds and coastal conditions.
sunlight: Hawthorn requires full sun to ensure vibrant flowering and fruiting.
Though adaptable, it performs best with at least six hours of sunlight.
Partial shade can be tolerated, but may reduce flower production.
Exposure to sunlight helps it develop strong branches and stems.
watering: Once established, hawthorn is quite drought-tolerant and hardy.
Regular watering during dry spells helps young trees thrive best.
Avoid overwatering as it can lead to root rot and other diseases.
Consistent moisture helps with dense foliage and budding of fruit.
soil: Hawthorn grows well in well-drained, loamy soils rich in nutrients.
It is adaptable to various soil conditions, including clay and sand.
Prefers slightly acidic to neutral pH levels for optimal health.
Compacted soil should be avoided as it hampers root expansion.
extra_care_tip: Pruning is important in late winter to maintain its shape and vigor.
